ğŸ“ Solution

This is a pretty simple challenge. The program first asks us to hand it a password and then reads a maximum of 255 bytes. The input is then ran through the â€œencryptInputâ€ function and then compared against the stored password â€œvfwqUdvvrjwa476â€. If the encrypted given password and the stored password are the same, a success message is shown to the user. The â€œencryptInputâ€ function is a simple xor encryptor that loops over the characters of the string while XORing them with the value 0d5. Running the stored password through the decryptor will give us â€œsecretPassword123â€.

Have a great day :) github.com/johnnnathan

ğŸ”‘ Keygen (Python)

input_string = "v`fw`qUdvvrjwa476"
xor_key = 5

xor_result = ''.join(chr(ord(char) ^ xor_key) for char in input_string)

print("Decrypted String: ", xor_result)
